    <span key="f502900c5bed43f481135268c3756a82"><span offset-key="f502900c5bed43f481135268c3756a82:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span><a href="https://lobste.rs/s/9fufgr/i_was_wrong_crdts_are_future" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="5c1419afa6eb40f285fc126c7cdc868a" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-72718_259-72719-237__"><span data-key="bd55f21aa84d442d99cbff457bcca359"><span data-offset-key="bd55f21aa84d442d99cbff457bcca359:0">Distributed state is so fundamentally complex that I think we actually need CRDTs (or something like them) to reason about it effectively.
